name: Sommerbock
description: A light bock lager, perfect for a summer day in the sun.

yeast: 1 package WLP833 German Bock Lager Yeast

brewing_instructions: Add 6 gallons of water to the kettle and add 1 Campden Tablet
Heat 6 gallons of strike water to 159°F
Add 6 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to the mash tun and confirm mash temperature of 149°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping grains, heat 4 gallons of water for lautering to 170 °F
Fly spage until wort volume of 7.4 gallons is reached
Begin boil and wait for hot break
At 0 minutes, add 7 drops of FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 1.0 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 30 minutes, add 1.0 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 45 minutes, add 2.0 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 50 minutes, add 1 tablet Whirlfloc
At 50 minutes, add 0.5 tsp of yeast nutrient
At 50 minutes, add 2 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 60 minutes, chil the wort to 68°F
Shake fermenter to aerate wort
Move wort to primary fermenter
Pitch yeast
Ferment at 52°F for 14 days
Ferment at 60°F for 97 days
Lower temp by -4°F daily to reach 34°F over 7 days
Condition at 34°F for 14 days
Move to keg and carbonate
starter_brewing_instructions: Add 3L of water to Ehrlenmeyer Flask
Add 6 oz Extra Light Dry Malt Extract
Add 2 drops FermCap to reduce foaming as needed
Allow yeast to multiply for 48 hours
